summary: This is a docket notice from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding a motion for bail/pretrial release filed on behalf of appellant Ghislaine Maxwell in her appeals (cases 21-770 and 21-58). The notice includes references to associated exhibits and lists the attorneys of record who were electronically served.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual for whom a motion for bail/pretrial release is being filed in her appeals before the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: Listed as an Assistant U.S. Attorney to receive electronic notice of the filed motion.

persons.name: David Oscar Markus
persons.context: Listed as an attorney (likely for the defense) to receive electronic notice of the filed motion. Email addresses for him and his firm are provided.

connections.description: Markus is listed as an attorney receiving notice for the motion filed on behalf of appellant Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating a legal representation relationship.
Stemheim, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is on the opposing legal side from Maxwell, representing the United States government in the case against her.

events.title: Motion for Bail Filed in Maxwell Appeal
events.description: A motion for bail (pretrial release) is filed on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell with the Second Circuit Court of Appeals in her cases (21-770, 21-58).

keyFacts: A motion for pretrial release (bail) was filed for Ghislaine Maxwell in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals on April 1, 2021.
The motion is associated with appellate case numbers 21-770 and 21-58.
The docket notice shows electronic service to defense attorney David Oscar Markus and Assistant U.S. Attorney Bobbi C. Stemheim.
The filing includes multiple exhibits (labeled A-N) supporting the motion for pretrial release.
